contentrichtext.text: '''Erwin Aders''' (1881–1974) was the chief designer for [[Germany]]'s [[Henschel & Son]], during [[World War II]]. He led the design for the heavy [[tanks]] [[Tiger I]] and [[Tiger II]].<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.alanhamby.com/history.html | title = The story of the Tiger I | first = Alan | last = Hamby }}</ref> == References == {{reflist}} {{Authority control|VIAF=81214089}} {{Persondata | NAME = Aders, Erwin | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = German engineer | DATE OF BIRTH = 1881 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1974 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Aders, Erwin}} [[Category:1881 births]] [[Category:1974 deaths]] [[Category:German engineers]] {{Germany-scientist-stub}} {{Germany-engineer-stub}}
